page.title: 14CONSERVATION OF FECKENHAM
page.content: There is a 28 acres conservation area, classified as a site of special scientific interest, called Feckenham Wylde Moor. It is owned by the Worcs. Nature Conservation Trust and was purchased in 1981 with the aid of grants and donations from interested parties. The site is of particular interest to conservationists because it is the remains of an extensive marsh which flooded due to blocked drainage from Brandon Brook and reverted to wetland conditions. The land had been drained and farmed from the mid 19th century but was of no agricultural use for crops. It was used for grazing. A large pool was excavated in 1982 and a number of smaller pools have been planned in order that the wet area be maintained. It is envisaged that aquatic species will be encouraged.
